abstract: Robin Pogrebin Inside Art Column; Dallas Museum of Art acquires one of six remaining Jackson Pollock sculptures; survey of work by British artist Allen Jones will open at Michael Werner Gallery in late March; installation of sculptures by artist Garnett Puett opens at School gallery end of May; Brant Foundation Art Study Center announces upcoming show Jonathan Horowitz: Occupy Greenwich; artist Joseph Nahmad presents exhibition inspired by Charles Baudelaire’s Les Fleurs du Mal at Nahmad Contemporary gallery.
lead_paragraph: The Dallas Museum of Art’s current survey of Jackson Pollock’s black paintings includes a recently acquired sculpture by that artist, one of six that survive.

headline.main: A Rare Pollock Sculpture Gets a Home
headline.print_headline: A Rare Pollock Sculpture Finds a Home in Dallas

snippet: The Dallas Museum of Art’s current survey of Jackson Pollock’s black paintings includes a recently acquired sculpture by that artist, one of six that survive.
